sub_topic: Preparation of acetylsalicylic acid from acetic anhydride and salicylic acid
message_1: What is the minimum amount (in grams) of salicylic acid needed to produce 10 grams of acetylsalicylic acid using acetic anhydride as a reagent in the synthesis of aspirin?
message_2:
To determine the minimum amount of salicylic acid needed to produce 10 grams of acetylsalicylic acid (aspirin), we can use stoichiometry.

First, we need the molecular weights of salicylic acid and acetylsalicylic acid:

Salicylic acid (C7H6O3) has a molecular weight of 138.12 g/mol.
Acetylsalicylic acid (C9H8O4) has a molecular weight of 180.16 g/mol.

Now, we can set up a stoichiometric conversion:

10 g acetylsalicylic acid * (1 mol acetylsalicylic acid / 180.16 g) * (1 mol salicylic acid / 1 mol acetylsalicylic acid) * (138.12 g salicylic acid / 1 mol) = 7.66 g salicylic acid

So, the minimum amount of salicylic acid needed to produce 10 grams of acetylsalicylic acid is 7.66 grams.
